summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for July 13, 2019. It details routine operational status, including staff shortages, inmate counts, and leave usage. The report was created the day after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and while he was housed at MCC, but it does not mention him by name.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Routine daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, including staff shortages leading to vacated correctional assignments and monitoring of inmates on psychological observation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: This report is dated July 14, 2019, covering activity for July 13, 2019, which was during the period Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at MCC New York prior to his death.
The report notes staff shortages on both the Day and Evening Watch shifts, leading to vacated correctional assignments in units 10-South and the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
The report indicates two inmates were on psychological observation (Psych Obs.) with inmate companions.
The total inmate population at the beginning of the morning shift on July 13, 2019, was 797.
The document is a standard administrative report showing no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein or any unusual incident for that specific date.
